revised_title: John Flamsteed: The First Astronomer Royal and His Observational Contributions
tldr: This book review discusses John Flamsteed's role as the first Astronomer Royal and his significant contributions to observational astronomy. Flamsteed's correspondence provides insight into the scientific politics of the time and his collaboration with other notable figures like Sir Christopher Wren and Sir Jonas Moore. The review highlights the importance of Flamsteed's work in establishing the Royal Observatory at Greenwich and his dedication to precise astronomical observations.
